body:
## Summary
This PR refactors the release tooling into a dedicated package structure to improve maintainability and separation of concerns.

- Move release build logic into separate `release_tool` package
- Update CI/CD workflows to use new release tool structure
- Add `scripts/uninstall.sh` for application cleanup
- Refactor `tool/grind.dart` to separate main CLI from release tool concerns
- Update dependencies to align with new structure

## Test plan
- [ ] Run `fvm install` and verify it still works correctly
- [ ] Run release workflow and verify release process completes
- [ ] Verify uninstall script removes all application files
- [ ] Check that all tests pass with new structure
title: refactor: migrate release tooling to dedicated package structure

body:
## Summary
Resolves Homebrew build failures caused by `pubspec_parse ^1.5.0` requiring Dart SDK >=3.6.0. The Homebrew formula currently bundles Dart SDK 3.2.6, which is incompatible with the newer constraint.

## Changes Made

### Core Fix
- Pin `pubspec_parse` to `">=1.2.0 <1.5.0"` to support Dart SDK 3.2.0+
- Simplifies pubspec serialization in `project_model.dart` to essential fields only
- Removes newer `pubspec_parse` features not available in older versions:
  - `executables`, `funding`, `topics`, `screenshots`
  - `homepage`, `repository`, `issueTracker`, `documentation`, `publishTo`
  - `dependencyOverrides`

### Compatibility Improvements  
- Fix ExitCode import conflicts by using `hide ExitCode` from `mason_logger`
- Add null-safe environment access for compatibility with older `pubspec_parse` versions
- Regenerate all mapper files with `build_runner`

### CI/Testing
- Add `test-min-sdk` job to automatically test with minimum SDK version
- Add `scripts/get_min_sdk_version.sh` helper script
- Prevents future SDK compatibility regressions

## Impact
- âœ… Works with Dart SDK 3.2.0+ (Homebrew's 3.2.6)
- âœ… Works with Dart SDK 3.9.0+ (current stable)
- âœ… All analyzer checks pass (warnings are false positives)
- âœ… CI will catch future minimum SDK compatibility issues

## Test Plan
- [x] Run `dart pub get` with minimum SDK (3.2.0)
- [x] Run `dart pub downgrade` to test minimum dependencies
- [x] Run `dart analyze --fatal-infos` with both min and max dependencies
- [x] Run `dart run build_runner build` to regenerate mappers
- [x] Verify Homebrew compatibility (SDK constraint matches 3.2.6)

Fixes #940
title: fix: maintain compatibility with Dart SDK 3.2.0+ for Homebrew builds

## Summary

This PR introduces comprehensive improvements to the testing infrastructure, focusing on parallel execution capabilities and CI optimization:

â€¢ **Enhanced test configuration** with categorized timeouts and parallel execution support
â€¢ **Fast integration tests** designed for efficient CI pipeline execution  
â€¢ **Performance validation suite** for monitoring system performance metrics
â€¢ **Optimized GitHub Actions workflow** with parallel job execution and caching improvements
â€¢ **Comprehensive documentation** including migration guide and testing best practices

## Key Features

- Test categorization (parallel, serial, fast, slow, performance) with appropriate timeouts
- Structured test reporting with JSON output and GitHub annotations
- Parallel integration test runner for faster CI execution
- Performance benchmarking capabilities
- Enhanced caching strategies for dependencies and build artifacts

## Test Plan

- [ ] Verify new test categories run within expected timeouts
- [ ] Confirm parallel integration tests execute correctly
- [ ] Validate GitHub Actions workflow optimization
- [ ] Check performance test baseline establishment
- [ ] Review migration guide completeness
title: feat: enhance testing infrastructure with parallel execution and CI optimization

body:
## Summary

This PR improves the natural readability and professional tone of documentation and code comments by removing overly formal AI-generated language patterns.

### Changes Made

- **README.md**: Simplified main project description to use direct, natural language
- **Monorepo guide**: Removed corporate jargon like "streamlining" and "crucial for avoiding"
- **Getting-started guide**: Simplified verbose AI-generated explanations  
- **Integration test command**: Replaced "comprehensive" with "complete" (4 instances)
- **Project model**: Improved method documentation clarity
- **Release document**: Removed marketing language from introduction
- **Integration test README**: Enhanced natural tone

### Benefits

âœ… **Improved readability** - More natural, human-friendly language
âœ… **Better user experience** - Clearer, more direct explanations  
âœ… **Enhanced professionalism** - Maintains technical accuracy with authentic tone
âœ… **Code quality** - Eliminates generic AI-generated patterns
âœ… **Consistency** - Unified voice across all documentation

### Technical Details

- 7 files modified with targeted text improvements
- Zero functional code changes
- Preserves all technical accuracy
- Maintains existing code formatting

## Review Notes

All changes are text-only improvements that enhance clarity without affecting functionality. The modifications create a more authentic, professional voice throughout the codebase while maintaining technical precision.
title: docs: improve language clarity and remove AI-generated patterns

body:
This PR adds nix "flake" configuration so that Nix users can easily use `fvm`
We use `devbox` which is an abstraction on top of nix to declaratively manage project dependencies. 
With this adding `fvm` to the project dev environment is as easy as running `devbox add github:leoafarias/fvm`
This will result in the "flake" added to your `devbox.json` (where all the dependencies are declared): 

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jetify-com/devbox/0.12.0/.schema/devbox.schema.json",
  "packages": [
    "github:leoafarias/fvm",
  ],
  "shell": {
    "init_hook": [
       "fvm flutter doctor"
    ]
  }
}
```

The benefit is this file is checked into the source control and everyone on the team will have fvm installed once they are in this dev environment :) 

### Testing steps for this pr

```
# install devbox
devbox init
devbox add github:mikeborodin/fvm/1eccdd2b3235b5455c613241f9ae78c7f1de2ae6
devbox shell
fvm list
```

This is my first PR here so let me know if I missed something ðŸ˜Š

thanks
title: feature: add Nix Flake support
